intro: Cheiridopsis quadrifida, commonly known as the four-leafed ice plant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, daisy-like flowers. The plant is typically found in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It produces a profusion of white or pale pink flowers during the winter months, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Cheiridopsis quadrifida is often used in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
